other_tests.findings: Demonstrated a smooth articular rim with no evidence of chondral irregularity.
Intact cartilaginous surface without any obvious areas of subchondral weakness.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At six months follow-up, the patient reported excellent pain relief and demonstrated improved left hip range of motion.

other_tests.findings: Unstable osteochondral flap with contrast medium tracking below the femoral head lesion and fissuring of the anterolateral acetabular labrum.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progressive hip subluxation and displacement of the osteochondral fragment.

other_tests.findings: Reduction of the right hip noted with deepening of the subchondral lesion.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At eighteen months follow-up, the patient had excellent function overall and was able to participate in sports.

other_tests.procedure_name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Arthrogram of Left Hip
other_tests.findings: Large femoral head osteochondral lesion in association with anterior and posterior labral tears and femoral head chondromalacia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At six months follow-up, there was a substantial decrease in the activity-related left hip pain.
